page.title: 11BEESLACK HOUSE AND GROUNDS
page.content: The lands at Beeslack, where the new Beeslack High School has been built, were originally acquired by the Cowan family who had a long connection with Penicuik, especially with the paper making industry. In the grounds there is a marble statue "Italian Dancing Girl" by John Hutchison R.S.A. In the nursery is a frieze depicting Joseph's life by the german artist Muller. The farm buildings occupied the present site of the stables complex. The last occupant of Beeslack, Miss Elizabeth Emington, now living at Elie in Fife says the name Beeslack was derived from "Bees" Lurk" and for many years honey bees thrived at Beeslack than in many other areas of the country. Beeslack House, now belonging to Lothian Regional Council, has lain empty for several years.
